organic.title: All the various types of sleigh bell I've found while metal detecting
organic.snippet: The various types are Conestoga: cone shaped, Crotal: 1 slot, petal design, Jingle: 2 slots, and 2 piece rumbler : brass crimped together.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you date an old bell?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Cast brass bells are rose-gold or brownish-gold in color when polished. Machine-stamped bells are butter-yellow in color. Nickel or tin plating dates bells to the 1870s or later. Chrome plating dates bells to the 1920s or later.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Dating Sleigh Bells - Classic Bells

peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: American sleigh bells made in the last two centuries are brass or bronze. According to DeeAnna, â€œWe buy antique sleigh bells from private individuals, estates and online auctions.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Classic Bells: Continuing the Holiday Tradition with Brass - Copper.org

peopleAlsoAsk.question: Should you polish antique sleigh bells?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: To polish or not to polish, that is the oft asked question! There is no one answer that is right for everyone. If you like your bells the way they are, then leave them unpolished. If your bells are black, crusty, and dirty, then get them spruced up so you can enjoy them.
